publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1252 Fergus Ewing: Evaluation of Open Day—That the Parliament congratulates all staff involved in the organisation and conduct of the open day on 30 September 2000; believes that to have around 5,000 people visit the Parliament Chamber, Visitor Centre, Committee Rooms and other facilities indicates the success of both the event and the policy which enables an open approach to access for the public to our Parliament, and believes that, after analysis of this years event, it would be useful to repeat the open day and consider making it a more regular event. Supported by: Colin Campbell*
S1M-1252 Evaluation of Open Day (lodged on 6 October 2000) Andrew Wilson*, Robin Harper*, Christine Grahame*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Michael Russell*
S1M-1252 Evaluation of Open Day (lodged on 6 October 2000) Fiona McLeod*

S1M-1252 Fergus Ewing: Evaluation of Open Day—That the Parliament congratulates all staff involved in the organisation and conduct of the open day on 30 September 2000; believes that to have around 5,000 people visit the Parliament Chamber, Visitor Centre, Committee Rooms and other facilities indicates the success of both the event and the policy which enables an open approach to access for the public to our Parliament, and believes that, after analysis of this year’s event, it would be useful to repeat the open day and consider making it a more regular event. Supported by: Colin Campbell, Andrew Wilson, Robin Harper, Christine Grahame, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Fiona McLeod, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-1252 Evaluation of Open Day (lodged on 6 October 2000) Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1252 Evaluation of Open Day (lodged on 6 October 2000) Margaret Smith*
S1M-1252 Evaluation of Open Day (lodged on 6 October 2000) Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*

S1M-1252 Fergus Ewing: Evaluation of Open Day—That the Parliament congratulates all staff involved in the organisation and conduct of the open day on 30 September 2000; believes that to have around 5,000 people visit the Parliament Chamber, Visitor Centre, Committee Rooms and other facilities indicates the success of both the event and the policy which enables an open approach to access for the public to our Parliament, and believes that, after analysis of this year’s event, it would be useful to repeat the open day and consider making it a more regular event. Supported by: Colin Campbell, Andrew Wilson, Robin Harper, Christine Grahame, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Fiona McLeod, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Margaret Smith, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Keith Harding*

S1M-1252 Fergus Ewing: Evaluation of Open Day—That the Parliament congratulates all staff involved in the organisation and conduct of the open day on 30 September 2000; believes that to have around 5,000 people visit the Parliament Chamber, Visitor Centre, Committee Rooms and other facilities indicates the success of both the event and the policy which enables an open approach to access for the public to our Parliament, and believes that, after analysis of this year’s event, it would be useful to repeat the open day and consider making it a more regular event. Supported by: Colin Campbell, Andrew Wilson, Robin Harper, Christine Grahame, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Fiona McLeod, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Margaret Smith, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Keith Harding, Nick Johnston, Michael Matheson, Ms Sandra White
